data.title: What to see in Matanzas
data.text:
Explore the province of Matanzas and discover the most interesting places to visit during your holidays

Matanzas offers a wide variety of tourist attractions that will allow you to enjoy your travel more and discover the culture of this captivating province.

Some of the most fascinating places you can visit are:

Sauto Theater

Be astounded by the mystery surrounding the remarkable Sauto Theater, located in Matanzas.

Plaza de la Vigía de Matanzas Square

Take a walk in the beautiful and colorful Plaza de la Vigía Square and gaze at the various stunning buildings surrounding it.

Parque de La Libertad de Matanzas Square

Stroll through the monumental city center of the “Athens of Cuba” and discover the welcoming La Libertad Park.

San Carlos Borromeo Cathedral

Take advantage of your visit to the San Carlos Borromeo Cathedral and witness the old architectural glory of Matanzas.

Versailles in Matanzas

Stroll through the streets of the historic French quarter of Matanzas, now the People’s Council, and cross the bridge over the Yumurí river.

Puente de la Concordia Bridge

Take a walk over one of the bridges with more history than the city of Matanzas, and connected to the Versailles quarter.

San Severino Castle

Visit the wonderful San Severino Castle and learn more about Matanzas’ fascinating past.

Iglesia de Monserrate Church

Visit the curious Iglesia de Monserrate Church and enjoy one of the most beautiful views over Matanzas.

Bellamar Caves

Take a boat tour on the waters of the Canímar river and let its mysterious fog envelop you with its magic.

Canímar River

Make a boat tour on the waters of the Canímar river and let its mysterious fog envelop you with its magic.

Saturno Cave

Be amazed by the magic hidden within the small Saturno Cave.

Varadero

Enjoy one of the most idyllic places in Cuba, with its glamorous hotels and amazing beaches.

Josone Park

Spend a relaxing day of family recreation in Josone Park, Varadero.

Xanadú Mansion

Order a refreshing Cuban mojito while you observe the breathtaking panoramic view from the roof of Xanadú Mansion.

Varadero Dolphinarium

Visit the Dolphinarium located in the Punta Hicacos Nature Park and take advantage of the opportunity to swim with dolphins.

Ambrosio Cave

Be delighted by the unreal atmosphere of the Ambrosio Cave and feel the presence of indians, pirates and slaves in the remains of its paintings.

Varahicacos Ecological Reserve

Visit the Varahicacos Reserve and learn more about the native flora and fauna in the north of Cuba.

San Juan de Dios de Cárdenas

Don’t miss the chance to visit Cárdenas, the perfect example of a Colonial city.

Zapata Peninsula

Visit the Zapata Peninsula and contemplate the area’s unique natural wonders you won’t find anywhere else.

Boca de Guamá

Visit Boca de Guamá and discover everything it has to offer you during your vacation to the south of the province of Matanzas.

Treasure Lagoon

Enjoy in Treasure Lagoon all the Taino traditions and legends surrounded by the most beautiful areas of nature in the south of Matanzas.

Guamá Crocodile Colony

Visit the crocodile colony located in Treasure Lagoon and discover a bit more about the habitat of this very interesting animal.

Montemar Natural Park

Explore the enticing Montemar Natural Park, declared Biosphere Reserve and home of numerous animals in Cuba.
